description: Time-Variant Specified-Head Package - Simulates specified-head boundary cells where the head can vary over time

variables.name: COMMENT
variables.description: Optional comment lines at beginning of file.
variables.tooltip: Lines starting with '#' are treated as comments and ignored by MODFLOW.

datasets.description: Maximum number of CHD cells and options

variables.name: Option
variables.description: Optional keyword 'AUXILIARY' followed by auxiliary variable names, and/or 'NOPRINT'.
variables.tooltip: AUXILIARY adds extra columns to the stress period data. NOPRINT suppresses CHD list output to listing file.

variables.name: MXACTC
variables.description: Maximum number of specified-head cells active during any stress period.
variables.tooltip: Maximum number of CHD entries used simultaneously. Determines memory allocation for the package.

variables.name: ITMP
variables.description: Number of CHD entries for this stress period. <0 reuses previous period data.
variables.tooltip: If > 0, ITMP CHD entries follow. If 0, no CHD cells active. If < 0, reuse the previous stress period's data.

variables.name: Layer
variables.description: Layer number of the specified-head cell (1-based).
variables.tooltip: Layer containing the constant-head cell. 1-based index.

variables.name: Row
variables.description: Row number of the specified-head cell (1-based).
variables.tooltip: Row location of the constant-head cell. 1-based index.

variables.name: Column
variables.description: Column number of the specified-head cell (1-based).
variables.tooltip: Column location of the constant-head cell. 1-based index.

variables.name: Shead
variables.description: Head at the start of the stress period (L).
variables.tooltip: Specified head value at the beginning of the stress period. Head is linearly interpolated between Shead and Ehead.

variables.name: Ehead
variables.description: Head at the end of the stress period (L).
variables.tooltip: Specified head value at the end of the stress period. The head varies linearly from Shead to Ehead during the period.
